title: No need for Deputy Defence Minister to resign to ensure an independent probe into Easter Sunday attacks: Govt.
byline: There is no necessity for Deputy Defence Minister Aruna Jayasekera to resign to ensure a fair probe into the Easter Sunday attacks as the probe is carried out by Ministry of Public Security, subject Minister Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Canadian passenger nabbed at BIA with Rs. 40 million worth hashi, cocaine
byline: A 52-year-old Canadian man was arrested this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with a large stock of illegal drugs worth around Rs. 40 million.

title: Convict freed by presidential pardon now jailed for 7 years in a fraud case
byline: The individual who was illegally released through a fabricated presidential pardon on Vesak Poya Day, Athula Thilakarathna, has, in a separate case, been found guilty of forgery and fraudulent use of documents and sentenced to seven years of rigorous imprisonment by the Anuradhapura High Court on Wednesday (23).

title: Suspected gunman shot dead by STF in Kahathuduwa
byline: The gunman involved in the failed shooting attempt near the Dehiwala railway station was shot dead by the Police Special Task Force (STF) early this morning in Pahalagama, Kahathuduwa.

title: Supreme Court orders CID probe into AG’s decision on X-Press Pearl legal action
byline: The Supreme Court yesterday ordered the CID to conduct investigations into matters arising from the Attorney General’s unreasonable, irrational, and arbitrary decision to institute civil legal action against the X-Press Pearl group of companies in a Singapore court, instead of initiating proceedings in the High Court of Sri Lanka under its Admiralty jurisdiction.

title: Govt.’s learning curve ending, project momentum building: Construction sector
byline: A top construction industry leader voiced cautious optimism for Sri Lanka’s construction sector, suggesting the government’s initial “learning curve” is now over and is anticipating a new sense of urgency in project

title: CID probes fake police document circulated on social media
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation into the circulation of a forged document falsely attributed to the Acting Inspector General of Police, which has been widely shared via WhatsApp and other social media platforms.

title: 7 children dead, 2 In ICU as Rajasthan school building collapses
byline: Seven children were killed and two were critically injured after a government school building collapsed in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar district on Friday.

title: 2026 budget should be underpinned by strong revenue measures, appropriate spending allocations: IMF
byline: The 2026 budget should be underpinned by strong revenue measures and appropriate spending allocations, consistent with IMF program parameters, the International Monetary Fund (IMF)said.

title: Licence of 219 pharmacies suspended: Minister
byline: The National Medicine Regulatory Authority (NMRA) has suspended the licences of 219 pharmacies in the country by July 18, 2025, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Initial steps being taken to introduce new Constitution: PM
byline: Initial steps are being taken to introduce a new Constitution, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka, France sign debt implementation letters
byline: Marking a key milestone in Sri Lanka’s external debt restructuring process, the Governments of Sri Lanka and France have officially signed the Implementation Letters related to their bilateral debt agreement, the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development said.

title: President to undertake state visit to Maldives on Monday
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayaka will undertake a state visit to Maldives from July 28-30, 2025 at the invitation of the President of Maldives Mohamed Muizzu,Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Former Minister P. Dayaratne passes away at 89
byline: Former Minister and senior parliamentarian P. Dayaratne has passed away at the age of 89, family sources confirmed.

title: UK Parliamentary delegation engages in High-Level dialogue with Sri Lankan lawmakers
byline: A high-level delegation of Members of Parliament from the United Kingdom, visiting Sri Lanka under the Westminster Foundation for Democracy (WFD) programme, met this week with a diverse group of Sri Lankan legislators, legal professionals, and civil society leaders to advance dialogue on inclusive governance, post-legislative scrutiny (PLS), and democratic reform.

title: Large cocaine slabs detected first time at BIA with Canadian Caucasian male
byline: An attempt to smuggle large one kilo cocaine slabs was thwarted for the first time in Bandaranaike International Airport history, when Sri Lanka Customs seized a Canadian man carrying bulk of Cocaine and Hashish worth around Rs.395 million this morning.

title: Video showing Lankan migrant worker moved by forklift prompts action from South Korea’s president
byline: South Korea’s president ordered officials to find ways to prevent the mistreatment of migrant workers after a video showing a Sri Lankan worker being moved by a forklift while tied up at a South Korean factory sparked public outrage.

title: Court orders probe involving Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe
byline: The Colombo Fraud Investigation Bureau today submitted a detailed report to the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court regarding an alleged fraud involving the lease of a two-storey building and land belonging to the National Workers’ Institute, based on a forged deed, for a sum of Rs. 3 million.

title: Sri Lanka to waive visa fees for 40 more countries
byline: The government has decided to waive visa fees for 40 more countries in a bid to strengthen the country’s tourism sector, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath said.

title: France will recognise Palestinian state, Macron says
byline: France will officially recognise a Palestinian state in September, President Emmanuel Macron has said, which will make it the first G7 nation to do so.
